extendedInfo.description: The revolutionary Carbs & Cals App contains over 2,500 food & drink photos with the carbohydrate, calorie, protein, fat & fibre values clearly displayed above each photo.FOR TECHNICAL SUPPORT, QUESTIONS AND SUGGESTIONS: Please email info@carbsandcals.com and we'll be happy to help!â FOOD & DRINK DATABASE:â¨ The App is currently available for the UK (2,500+ food & drink photos) and Portugal (900+ photos), with the database being expanded all the time.â PORTION SIZES: Up to 6 portion photos for each item (perfect for portion control & weight loss!)â BRANDED FOODS:â¨ Customer favourites, such as Kelloggâs, Dominoâs, Danone, Weetabix, Ryvita, Yakult, Dorset Cereals, Innocent, Alpen, Nakd, Ready Brekâ¦and many more coming soon!â FOOD & DRINK CATEGORIES: â¨22 different categories covering Biscuits & Crackers, Branded Foods, Bread, Breakfast, Cakes & Bakery, Desserts, Drinks, Eggs & Cheese, Fruit,  Ingredients (for cooking & baking), Meals, Meal Accompaniments, Meat, Chicken & Fish, Nuts & Seeds, Potatoes, Rice, Pasta & Grains, Sauces & Spreads, Seasonal, Snacks, Take-aways, Vegetables & Pulses and Yoghurt.â MY FOODS:â¨ Take photos of your own food and add them to a customised list in the App!â MEAL CALCULATOR: â¨No need for scales or complicated calculations! Just look at the food on your plate, find the food in the App, choose the relevant portion size & add it to the Meal Calculator.â INTEGRATED CALENDAR: Store a breakfast, lunch, dinner & 3 snacks per day in the Calendar to keep track of the food & drink you consume each day. âDAILY TARGETS:â¨ Calculates your estimated calorie & nutrient intake and gives you daily targets for carbs, cals, protein, fat & 5-a-day.â¨â RECIPE BUILDER: Add components of a recipe & the App will automatically calculate the nutritional information per serving.â EXERCISE: Calculates calories burned in a wide range of different exercise and keeps track of your activity in the Diary.â DOWNLOAD ALL IMAGES FACILITY: For using the App when no Internet access is available (e.g. in restaurants, on holiday, and when out & about.)â Compiled by Chris Cheyette MSc BSc (Hons) RD, Diabetes Specialist Dietitian & Yello Balolia BA (Hons), Photographic Artist.PLEASE NOTE: The App is available for Android phones with OS 2.1 & up, with autofocus camera.HAVE A SUGGESTION OR QUESTION? Email info@carbsandcals.com and we'll do our best to help you or improve the App and release a free update. PLEASE USE OUR EMAIL AS WEâRE NOT ABLE TO RESPOND TO MARKET REVIEWS.â Customer Feedback about Carbs & Cals ââPerfect in every way! Very, very helpful and professional!!ââ¨âThis book has been life-changing for my son & husband, both of whom are diabetic.ââHelped me realize how the portion sizes I was eating were far too large.ââThis is brilliant for anyone who needs to count their Carbs and Calories!ââA must for diabetics.ââVery useful for losing weight.ââWell worth the purchase price - I can see me referring to this quite often.ââGives a real representation of how many carbs are in different portion sizes, and this is invaluable in carb counting.ââGuesstimates are often way out, so this is a huge help.â

reviews.title: Setting own targets?
reviews.comment: Very good app. Love the picture portion sizes and its ease of function! But for some reason it won\'t let me set my own targets for weight loss/maintenance/gain, once that is sorted it will be 5 out of 5 !!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Needs some work
reviews.comment: Yes only 3 stars at the moment. 1st, Fix the my foods feature when you add a photo. 2nd, Is there any way of exporting my data to a pc or other device? OnTrack is a FREE diabetes app that beats this app in MANY areas hands down. This app was recommended by a diabetes specialist so I expected better.
reviews.author: martin bergin

reviews.title: Waste of four pounds
reviews.comment: The idea of this app is very good, but the execution is lacking. The bar code scanner scans and then says it cannot connect to the server. Every time I set my target calories and it resets to something else. There are other apps like myfitnesspal that do exactly the same as this app and its free and works fully. Don\'t waste the money, this app will help you loose four pounds but it won\'t be in weight.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Could be so much better
reviews.comment: This is a very handy app to have when working out your carbs. The only thing that let\'s it down is that barcode scanner will not wrekonize top food brands so you have to put the info by hand.
reviews.author: Lloyd Simpson

reviews.title: Needs improving
reviews.comment: A bit disappointed with this app as I never manage to scan the bar code of a new peoduct, get the same message:\" There is no such food in database.Would you like to create custom food?\". Ok...then you create a custom food, take a picure of the product but the picture doesn\'t appear. The apps looks like needs lots of improvement, shame that I have to pay for it!! Hope this will be sortet out with further upgrates. Only 3 stars for now ..hope I will be able to give 5 stars in the future.
reviews.author: Marius Musan

reviews.title: Great idea, but.....
reviews.comment: This is fantastic as a carb counter, your nutritional info for the day is very easy to see and I found adding food to the database really easy too. But I found it quite tricky to negotiate my way round the app, and I still haven\'t worked out an easy  way to add a food to a saved meal! The database isnt great - apparently tomatoes do not exist, but cherry tomatoes do?? And I\'ve actually just lost all of the database for no apparent reason! So it\'s just not as good as I hoped it\'d be.
reviews.author: Caroline Beevers

reviews.title: Carbs and Cals - EXCELLENT
reviews.comment: This is a fantastic app!!! It\'s helped me to lose weight and has given a bad diabetic far better control than i\'ve ever had since I became diabetic in 1984. SUPERB!!!!
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good app BUT.....
reviews.comment: Good app BUT why oh why does it not show the photo taken of your own meal and save it! This frustrates me soooo much!  You would score a perfect 5 if you can resolvd this quickly!! But for now only scoring you a 3!!
reviews.author: marie cuthbert -rashrash

reviews.title: Love the app but it needs fixing
reviews.comment: Nice easy app to use, great for controlling carbs. Scanner is working but server isn\'t. When ever i scan a barcode, it says found but then you get an Server error and cannot go any further. Definitely 5 stars if you fix it or even if you then let people enter the data so its there for future use
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not worth the price paid!
reviews.comment: 25.000 foods on database? More like 25. False advertising springs to mind it doesn\'t have coffee on there!!! One of the most well known drinks on the planet yet it has tea?? Very disappointed will be requesting refund thought this would help my carb counting my insulin pump does better!
reviews.author: Steve Kulscar

reviews.title: Great for carb counting diabetics
reviews.comment: Although a fanastic idea, the navigation needs working on and the database is too small.  The search function also needs alot of improvement.  Overall a must have for carb counting diabetics but has multiple usability issues that i hope to see fixed on future updates
reviews.author: Richard Daxter

reviews.title: Great but...
reviews.comment: Great app (as I\'m a visual person). But the scanner is not working, the red line is there, but it\'s surrounded by multi-coloured stripes and doesnt show the barcode when I press it to scan something. It\'s annoying because I\'ve paid for an app and can\'t get to use all of it. Please fix and it\'ll definitely be a 5 star rating
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Good app but a couple of things not working
reviews.comment: This app is a really good idea and will be very useful to keep track of my carbs.  I\'ve only downloaded it today but I\'ve noticed a fouple of things not working as they should. Firstly the feature where you take a photo of the food you are adding is not working.  It takes the picture but does not save it. Also in the diary, where it keeps track of your daily carbs, it seems to add 1 carb on top of your daily amount so is inaccurate, but this is just a minor quibble. If these issues are fixed as well as the database updated with more branded items and takeaways, it will be a 5 star app for me.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Great but problems
reviews.comment: Was awesome on iPhone,  this version crashes a lot,  when i try to download images for use offline it appears to get stuck after three hours on a decent network connection.
reviews.author: Andrew Foxhall

reviews.title: Great for weight loss
reviews.comment: I like the visual aspect of portion sizes. I feel like my totals are more accurate than guessing weight  I would like to see a couple of tweaks to make it worth 5. I would like to see fruit values accumulated. Small portions of veg don\'t register as your 5 a day - in a salad for example - but added together would prob count for 2 of your 5. Also would be useful to set whole meals - kind of like the recipes facility-s I wouldn\'t have to enter to same order of food each time or just edit one item in the meal.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Disappointing - great concept but...
reviews.comment: I know fellow diabetics that rave about the book, but I didn\'t want to carry around in my ever increasing bag so thought this app would be an awesome idea.  Previously I only used free apps and am used to them having blips etc but assumed that was because they were free.  From this it seems paid ones are no more reliable or professional.  The \'download all pictures\' option only seems to download 1/3 of pics despite there being plenty of space on my phone and card.  This means eating out in areas of poor signal you spend so much time waiting for photos to download to gauge your portion size that the meal is cold before you get to eat it!  It also eats your data usage, and battery life.  My phone won\'t last a full day without charging now if used at every mealtime - nothing worse than thinking you have the tool in your handbag but when you get your meal out you can\'t use tool as either no battery or signal!  The variety of meals/foods I thought would be larger than the DAFNE app but I still find it lacking and can only work out half of my meals from it - and I don\'t eat unusual things!  Would stick to book if you want the portion sizes photos, otherwise download DAFNE
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Not what I thought
reviews.comment: This app is more geared for European foods not American. Not helpful at all.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Alright
reviews.comment: I have type 1 Diabetes, and this can be helpful out and about. Sadly, the app is let down. Search is not very good, a search for \"Honey\" will bring up many results before actual Honey appears. The UI is out of date and, I\'m going to be a little blunt here, looks ugly. Custom foods is a good feature, but I feel it could be better implemented, I shouldn\'t have to know the specific weight of food. Adding images to custom foods does not work. Downloading all images hangs at around 35/36mb.  Needs fixing.
reviews.author: Jack Fifield

reviews.title: Excellent App but lacking Function on Android
reviews.comment: This is an excellent app but its 2 biggest drawbacks are A) When you add your own food to compliment the vast range that is already there you can take a photos of the the food you want to add BUT the photo doesn\'t show up on Android phones so all you get is a question Mark. It appears to work fine on Iphones B) No Exports to Excel, CSV etc. bad move. Is it worth \302\2434 for the android version? Absolutely not. If the photo display issue is fixed then yes but it should be a free app on Android. \"On Track\" is a good free app and is on a par with Carbs&Cals (unless C&C can get the photo issues sorted and then it\'ll be 5 stars plus
reviews.author: Peter Leswell
